page.title: 12ASHDON GOLDSTONES FARM
page.content: {Goldstones}farm,one of the oldest and the second largest farm in our area,is farmed by Mr.Robert Furze.He owns 640 acres and rents another 90 acres.This farm is typical of other farms in Ashdon except that few other farms have livestock. This year Mr.Furze is growing 240 acres of wheat,300 acres of barley and 100 acres of sugar beet. Copses take up 14 acres and the rest is rough grazing land.Mr.Furze does not grow rape but grows sugar beet instead for he has not the equipment for drying the rape.He does not grow potatoes because he can only manage the one root crop and prefers sugar beet.To grow these crops the farmer uses 160 tonnes artificial fertiliser each year and is lucky to be able to use the pig manure on his fields.The soil at Goldstones is very fertile and the farmer gets a high yield.
